result.execSummary:
The defendant Laderle R Williams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Use Dangerous Weapon (Felony 2-5 Yrs)], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Consecutive to: To any other sentence, with credit for 12 days time served.
Court advises the Defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113 the amount actually served may be extended, and that the Defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison. The Defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to extended supervision, and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the Defendant being returned to prison.
Conditions the same as probation except for condition time.

miscConds.notes: Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments, and surcharges, including DNA surcharge, cash bail to apply. Any remaining balance to be returned to the remitter.

No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm holster, firearm magazine, or any body armor or stun guns.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions: Firearm possession and Voting.

No use or possession of controlled substances without valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
No controlled substance without a valid prescription for himself.
Defendant may not work at any exotic or strip dance business.
Defendant may not reside or work in a place where a gun is kept.

Mental Health evaluation and any recommended treatment.
Provide a DNA sample, if not already done.

Maintain absolute sobriety, no alcohol.
Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including drug and alcohol testing.

timeConds.notes:
Release for work and the Day Reporting Center; without good time credit. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. 
Court allows a report date of 3-10-2015 at 8:15am, Br.17. Court notes any violations of bail would result in a loss of release privileges.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Laderle R Williams

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript (20 pages) SENTENCING HEARING commencing APRIL 7, 2015 received and filed.
Bail Refund Packet
Bail refund notice, affidavit sent 03/16/15.

Defendant Laderle R Williams in court with attorney Thomas J. Kasen.  Zachary A. Wittchow for Dennis Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Br. 17 for Br. 3.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 30 MONTHS, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 12 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 18 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 12 MONTHS.  
Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program. 
Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on probation for 3 YEARS with the following conditions:
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
Court ordered defendant to serve 9 MONTHS condition time at the House of Correction; release for work and the Day Reporting Center; without good time credit. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring.  
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION AND EXTENDED SUPERVISION:

- Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no alcohol.
- No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid 
  prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
  and successfully complete recommended treatment
  including drug and alcohol testing. 
- No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
- No controlled substance without a valid prescription for himself. 
- No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm holster, firearm magazine, or any body armor or stun guns.
- Maintain full time work.
- Defendant may not work at any exotic or strip dance business. 
- Defendant may not reside or work in a place where a gun is kept.
- Mental Health Evaluation and any recommended treatment. 
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 
- Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, cash bail to apply. Any remaining balance to be returned to the remitter. 

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.
Court advises the Defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113 the amount actually served may be extended, and that the Defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison. The Defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to extended supervision, and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the Defendant being returned to prison. 
Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 
Defense request a report date. Arguments heard. For the reasons placed on the record the Court allows a report date of 3-10-2015 at 8:15 a.m., Br. 17. Court notes any violations of bail would result in a loss of release privileges.  Calendar call scheduled for March 10, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw
Memorandum from agent Rebecca Lesada, received and filed.  NO PSI completed.  aw
Justice Point Pretrial Services Violation Report received and filed due to new arrest.  aw

Defendant Laderle R Williams in court with attorney Thomas J. Kasen.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
2ND AMENDED Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  

AS TO THE AMENDED INFORMATION:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court also advises defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing.  Defense requests PSI.  PSI order, signed and filed.  Case adjourned for sentencing on 3/6/2015 at 1:30 pm, branch 3. 
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement, received and filed.  aw

2ND AMENDED INFORMATION, Received and filed.  

Count 1:  Possession of narcotic drugs, use of a dangerous weapon, contary to WI Stats sec. 961.41(3g)(am), 939.50(3)(i), 939.63(1)(c).  A class I felony.  aw

Defendant Laderle R Williams in court with attorney Alejandro A Lockwood.  Defendant Laderle R Williams in custody.  Timothy J Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  
On motion of the State, Court orders the charging section, paragraph 3, of the complaint amended to reflect the correct penalty enhancer term of "5 years" rather than "6 months".
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 3, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, recompense is not an issue.
